      29                 :            : /**
      30                 :            :  * Defines the conversion between grid_map and costmap_2d.
      31                 :            :  * -> There is only one distinct value for no information in the grid map.
      32                 :            :  * -> All values smaller or equal to freeSpace are considered free space (except noInformation).
      33                 :            :  * -> All values bigger or equal to lethalObstacle are
      34                 :            :  * considered a lethal obstacle (except noInformation).
      35                 :            :  * -> All values between inscribedInflatedObstacle and
      36                 :            :  * lethalObstacle are considered an inscribed inflated obstacle (except noInformation).
      37                 :            :  * -> All other values are interpolated between freeSpace and inscribedInflatedObstacle
      38                 :            :  * @tparam noInformation               Gridmap value that represents no information.
      39                 :            :  * @tparam lethalObstacle              Gridmap value (lower bound) for lethal obstacles.
      40                 :            :  * @tparam inscribedInflatedObstacle   Gridmap value (lower bound) for inscribed inflated obstacles.
      41                 :            :  * @tparam freeSpace                   Gridmap value (upper bound) for free space.
      42                 :            :  */
      43                 :            : template<int64_t noInformation, int64_t lethalObstacle, int64_t inscribedInflatedObstacle,
      44                 :            :   int64_t freeSpace>
      45                 :            : class Costmap2DTranslationTable
      46                 :            : {
      47                 :            :   // Check required pre-conditions of template arguments
      48                 :            :   static_assert(
      49                 :            :     freeSpace < inscribedInflatedObstacle,
      50                 :            :     "[Costmap2DTranslationTable] Condition violated: freeSpace < inscribedInflatedObstacle.");
      51                 :            :   static_assert(
      52                 :            :     inscribedInflatedObstacle < lethalObstacle,
      53                 :            :     "[Costmap2DTranslationTable] Condition violated: inscribedInflatedObstacle < lethalObstacle.");

      55                 :            :     (noInformation < freeSpace) || (noInformation > lethalObstacle),
      56                 :            :     "[Costmap2DTranslationTable] Condition violated: "

     315                 :            :   /*!
     316                 :            :    * Initialize the output map at the robot pose of the underlying Costmap2DROS object.
     317                 :            :    *
     318                 :            :    * Note: This needs some beyond just fixing the center of the output map to the robot pose
     319                 :            :    * itself. To avoid introducing error, you want to shift the center so the
     320                 :            :    * underlying costmap2d cells align with the newly created map object. This does
     321                 :            :    * that here.
     322                 :            :    *
     323                 :            :    * @warning this does not lock the costmap2d object, you should take care to do so from
     324                 :            :    * outside this function in scope with any
     325                 :            :    * addLayerFromCostmap2DAtRobotPose calls you wish to make.
     326                 :            :    *
     327                 :            :    * @param costmap2d : the underlying Costmap2DROS object
     328                 :            :    * @param geometry: size of the subwindow to snapshot around the robot pose
     329                 :            :    * @param outputMap : initialise the output map with the required parameters
     330                 :            :    */

     342                 :            :     }

     347   [ +  -  +  - ]:          3 :       rosMapOrigin(costmap2d.getCostmap()->getOriginX(), costmap2d.getCostmap()->getOriginY());
     348                 :            :     Position newCostMapOrigin;
     349                 :            : 
     350                 :            :     // Note:
     351                 :            :     //   You cannot directly use the robot pose as the new 'costmap center'
     352                 :            :     //   since the underlying grid is not necessarily exactly aligned with
     353                 :            :     //   that (two cases to consider, rolling window and globally fixed).
     354                 :            :     //
     355                 :            :     // Relevant diagrams:
     356                 :            :     //  - https://github.com/anybotics/grid_map
     357                 :            : 
     358                 :            :     // Float versions of the cell co-ordinates, use static_cast<int> to get the indices.
     359                 :            :     Position robotCellPosition = (robotPosition - rosMapOrigin) / resolution;
     360                 :            : 
     361                 :            :     // if there is an odd number of cells
     362                 :            :     //   centre of the new grid map in the centre of the current cell
     363                 :            :     // if there is an even number of cells
     364                 :            :     //   centre of the new grid map at the closest vertex between cells
     365                 :            :     // of the current cell
